alert.note: Alert for Dade (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 11:11AM CDT until April 13 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Hickory. In southwest Missouri, Barton, Cedar, Dade, Greene and Polk. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1111 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Slagle Creek at 86 Road, Bear Creek at 60th Road, Asher Creek at 560 Road, Turkey Creek at Highway W and Sons Creek at County Road 113. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stockton, Greenfield, Humansville, Lockwood, Golden City, Walnut Grove, Fair Play and Morrisville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
